original_solution_mapping.L1: Kate bought 7 packs * 18 balls/pack = <<7*18=126>>126 red bouncy balls.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She also bought 6 packs * 18 balls/pack = <<6*18=108>>108 yellow bouncy balls.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Kate bought 126 balls - 108 balls= <<126-108=18>>18 more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 240.
    Returns: the number of more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls Kate bought.
    """
    # L1
    red_packs = 7 # 7 packs of red bouncy balls
    balls_per_pack = 18 # Each pack contained 18 bouncy balls
    red_bouncy_balls = red_packs * balls_per_pack

    # L2
    yellow_packs = 6 # 6 packs of yellow bouncy balls
    yellow_bouncy_balls = yellow_packs * balls_per_pack

    # L3
    difference = red_bouncy_balls - yellow_bouncy_balls

    # FA
    answer = difference
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Kate bought {red_packs} packs × {balls_per_pack} balls/pack = <<{red_packs}*{balls_per_pack}={red_bouncy_balls}>>{red_bouncy_balls} red bouncy balls.
She also bought {yellow_packs} packs × {balls_per_pack} balls/pack = <<{yellow_packs}*{balls_per_pack}={yellow_bouncy_balls}>>{yellow_bouncy_balls} yellow bouncy balls.
Kate bought {red_bouncy_balls} balls - {yellow_bouncy_balls} balls= <<{red_bouncy_balls}-{yellow_bouncy_balls}={difference}>>{difference} more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Kate bought 18 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<18*18=324>>324 red bouncy balls.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She also bought 6 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<6*18=108>>108 yellow bouncy balls.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Kate bought 324 balls - 108 balls= <<324-108=216>>216 more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'balls_per_pack' (18) was used instead of 'red_packs' (7).
